text:
Has anyone been able to update an existing task owner to No One via API?

I have tried setting owner to null but it doesn't work - the API still returns a successfull response.
set it to an empty string `""`
oh

Hi, it seems like HubSpot does not have an API for getting file CONTENTS. We can get file metadata (size, extension, private/public, others) via the API here but not contents. Has anyone encountered a similiar issue and come up with any solution or workaround? I'm thinking we'll need to use an external file storage like google drive if not? Any insights anyone might have would be greatly appreciated! Thanks!  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/files>

hello everyone, i have created  a custom object in HubSpot called customObject, i want to get the definition id of the association between my custom object and contact , so i can use this end point `/crm-associations/v1/associations/:objectId/HubSpot_DEFINED/:definitionId`
i need to know the definition id of the association
can't find it in the list in HubSpot
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/associations>
since the object is a custom object created by me
i will appreciate any help

Hi I haven't used this yet but in the documentation they have this reference If you create custom objects or custom association labels, the related association types will have unique `typeId` values that you'll need to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/api/crm/associations#retrieve-association-type|retrieve> or locate in your <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/object-settings/create-and-use-association-labels#association-label-api-details|association settings in HubSpot> did you check the linked articles?
Seems like you need to retrieve the list of associations via the API first

Hey everyone. I'm trying to send a couple of params every time someone signs up. I'm sending them through tracking code events:

``` HubSpot.identify(user.id, user.email, {
          mindstudio_joined_date: user.dateJoined
            ? new Date(user.dateJoined).toISOString().split('T')[0]
            : null,
          consent_sign_up: user.hasSetInitialAttributionData
            ? user.notificationSettings.marketingEmails.toString()
            : (getItem('marketingConsent') !== false).toString(),
        });```
mindstudio_joined_date and consent_sign_up are my two internal value names in HubSpot
you will need to first create the association.
Bringing this back around because I'm also experiencing this error. Any ideas on how to access the necessary scopes?

@everyone Is there any API that can fetch contacts attribute unique values instead of pulling all the contacts information and then sort the unique values of any attribute i.e all the countries list from where all the contacts belongs. 

PS: I want to implement filters from existing contacts data before pulling the contacts from HubSpot contacts api.
you can get contacts and use the `idProperty` check out the docs, should be in there

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/analytics-and-events/tracking-code>

i’m not sure exactly what you have going on here wiht your code setup, but if you look through here and do the push thing, that might help..

You didn’t really ask a question
you can do this through the api or you can use the UI when you are in the assocations settings in HubSpot, and look at the URL when you go through your assocations

I think they need the distinct values for any given Contact property

If the property is already defined in HubSpot as an enumerated property (dropdown, checkboxes or radio form fields), you should be able to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/properties|use the Properties API> <@U07CQJLSXPY>
For other properties, I don't think there is an out of the box solution.
